Prerequisites: PREREQUISITE(S): ACG 3113,ACG 3401 & QMB 3302 BUSINESS ANAL. STUDENTS ARE ADVISED TO COMPLETE ACG 3341,4123,BUL 3320,&TAX 4001 PRIOR TO ENROLLING IN ACG 4632
Course Description: AS THE CAPSTONE COURSE FOR ACCOUNTING MAJORS, AUDITING STUDIES THE ROLE OF AUDITORS AND METHODOLOGY FOR EXAMINING CORPORATE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS USING GENERALLY ACCEPTED AUDITING STANDARDS (GAAS) TO DETERMINE WHETHER THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS MEET GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES (GAAP).
Textbook(s): 1) AUDITING AND ASSURANCE SERVICES, 5TH EDITION BY LOUWERS, ET. AL. ISBN 978-0-07-752016-8
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
